Class Description
Action
This enum is an element that each PlayerAction and Pack must have.
ActionTest
This test will manage to test all the possible action that can be received by a controller and handle them.

APOLLO Your Worker may move into an opponent Workerâ€™s space by forcing their Worker to the space yours just vacated.

ArtemisMoves
ARTEMIS Your Worker may move one additional time, but not back to its initial space
ArtemisMoveTest
ARTEMIS Your Worker may move one additional time, but not back to its initial space
ArtemisWin
ARTEMIS Since you can move 2 times you also win even if your initial height was 1
AskPrometheusPowerWindow
JDialog that asks if the player wants to use prometheus' power
AskToUseTheGodsPower
JDialog that asks if the player wantw to use his god's power
AthenaMoves
ATHENA If one of your Workers moved up on your last turn, opponent Workers cannot move up this turn
AthenaMovesTest
ATHENA If one of your Workers moved up on your last turn, opponent Workers cannot move up this turn
AtlasBuild
ATLAS Your Worker may build a dome at any level including the ground.
AtlasBuildTest
ATLAS Your Worker may build a dome at any level including the ground.
Battlefield
A Battlefield is a matrix of Cell It has a list with all the Players that are currently play on that Battlefield
BattlefieldCliTest  
BattlefieldLimitTest  
BuildBehavior
This is the interface for the build behavior.
BuildContext
This is the context for the build behavior.
ButtonHandler
Class that handles all the mouse click and interprets them by putting the correct image on the right spot
Cell
Each Cell is a little square that form the Battlefield.
CellButton
Gui button of the cell, which the user interacts with by clicking, to select the move, build, ecc..
CellTest
Test methods for Cell class
ChooseGodCardToPlayWindow
Displays all the existing god available for a game, and by passing the mouse over each one of them, it will be displayed its power, in order to choose your favorite!
ChooseGodCardWindow  
ChronusWin
CRONUS You also win when there are at least five Complete Towers on the board.
ChronusWinTest
CRONUS You also win when there are at least five Complete Towers on the board.
Client
The client is an object that communicate both with remote view via socket and with view or swing view via observers.
ClientAppCLI
Main class for running a game and play it with a CLI
ClientAppGUI
Main class to run a game and play it with a GUI
ConfirmButton
Default button used to confirm choices
Connection  
Controller
The Controller contains the game logic It receives a PlayerMove from the Server The Controller modifies the Model via ad-hoc method selected by the playerAction
DemeterBuild
DEMETER Your Worker may build one additional time, but not on the same space.

GameFrame
Main Frame of the game for the Gui, where the player can see all the god cards in game and the relative powers, the tokens on the field, read messages and play santorini!
GameLostPanel
Panel which displays that the player lost
GameOverDialog
Dialog window showing winning or losing messages
GameWonPanel
Panel which displays that the player lost
GodButton
Button to select your GodCard
GodCard
All God Cards that can be used in a game Each one contains the info about their power
GodPanel
Panel which displays the Gods
GodSelectedWindow
It displays a nice graphic of the selected gods for the game
HephaestusBuild
HEPHAESTUS Your Worker may build one additional block (not dome) on top of your first block",
HeraWin
HERA An opponent can not win by moving on to a perimeter space.
HeraWinTest
HERA An opponent can not win by moving on to a perimeter space.
HestiaBuild
HESTIA Your worker may build one additional time.
InnerMainPanel
Creates al the necessary graphic tools for the main Gameframe, and passes them to the actual GameFrame, which display them in a nice way for the user.
LimusBuild
LIMUS Opponents Workers can not build on spaces neighboring your workers, unless building a dome to create a Complete Tower");
LogoPanel
Initial frame in which the user has to click PLAY to start the game
MinotaurMoves
MINOTAUR Your Worker move into an opponent Workerâ€™s space, if their Worker can be forced one space straight backwards to an unoccupied space at any level
MinotaurMoveTest  
Model
The model contains a battlefield and the info to let the game run properly It also has all the methods to change itself and to check if a move is valid or not
ModelUtils
It extract from the model the battlefield, the turn and all player.
MoveBehavior
Each GodCard that modify the move mechanics has to implement at least one of those methods.
MoveContext
Here is where the model can chose what kind of move has to be called.
NickNamePanel
It loads the panel on wich the user has to select his nickname for the game
NickNameWindow
Frame for recognising the user from its name, which will be his username for the game
NumberOfPlayersPanel
Little frame to let the first user select the number of players he wants to play with [2/3]
NumberOfPlayersWindow
Little frame to let the first user select the number of players he wants to play with [2/3]
Observable<Message>  
Observer<Message>  
Pack
A pack is an object that pairs with a TokenColor and both make a server response.
PanWin
PAN You also win if your Worker moves down two or more levels.
PanWinTest
PAN You also win if your Worker moves down two or more levels.
Pics
Enum with all the useful images for tui GUI
Player
A Player is an object that has an unique view.
PlayerAction  
PowerPanel
Panel that ask the user if he wants to use hig god Power
PrometheusMove
PROMETHEUS If your Worker does not move up, it may build both before and after moving.
PrometheusPanel
Panel that ask the user if he wants to use hig Prometheus Power, because prometheus changes radically the turn
PrometheusTest
PROMETHEUS: If your Worker does not move up, it may build both before and after moving.
RemoteView
The remote view is an object that hide the whole connection to the server It receive and send object into the socket and notify the controller as it is a real view
Server
A server initiate a connection between some client and link them with a remote view Each player that connect is put into a lobby When there are enough players to play the game start
ServerApp
This class creates the server and runs it Only one server can run at the same time The server will shut down when there are no players connected after a player connect
ServerResponse
This is the message that is constructed by the model and has to be sent to each view.
SimpleBuild
A token can build in all 8 Cells around himself except the cell's that are a dome, the cell's where there is a player.
SimpleMoves
SIMPLE COMPUTE VALID MOVES This method check for normal moves that a token can perform.
SimplePerformBuildTest
This just receive a Cell and call the incrementHeight method on that cell.
SimplePerformMoveTest
A token can move in all 8 Cells around himself with the following exceptions: he can not occupy a cell where is another token (regardless if it's his own or not); he can not move up on a height >1 of it's own; he can not move on a dome; he can not move out the battlefield.
SimpleValidBuildTest
A token can build in all 8 Cells around himself except the cell's that are a dome, the cell's where there is a player.
SimpleValidMoveTest  
SimpleWin
A player win the game if he go from a level 2 build to a level 3 build
SimpleWinTest
A player win the game if he go from a level 2 build to a level 3 build.
SwingView
Class that implements the user view of the game, if he selects to use the Graphic User Interface
Token
Each Player has 2 tokens They are created with no position and when it is assigned they always have a position Each token can move in any adjacent cell, with any exceptions it can not move on a cell occupied by another token, it can not move on a cell that is a dome, it can not move on a cell that has a delta-height >= 2
TokenColor
A TokenColor object has the purpose to identify which player has which tokens Each token and each player has a proper TokenColor and if it is the same it means that that player has the control of that token
Utility  
View
Class that implements the user view of the game, if he selects to use the Command Line Interface
WelcomeFrame
The first frame that invites the user to play, he has just to click on PLAY
WinBehavior
This is the interface for the win behavior.
WinContext
This is the context for the win behavior.
ZeusBuild
ZEUS: Your Worker may build a block under itself.
ZeusBuildTest
